citations.narrative:
There are accumulations of brown debris and wet bedding around the automatic water valves for the 20 metal enclosures
in the guinea pig building. These accumulations around the water valves can expose the guinea pigs to potential disease
infections with bacterial, fungi, and parasites. Water receptacles such as automatic water delivery lines must be cleaned
whenever dirty and sanitized at least once every two weeks. Licensee must establish and maintain a program to keep the
water valves clean when dirty, and must sanitize the water valves and area around the valves at least once every 2
weeks. Correct by February 21, 2025.

There are accumulations of soiled and wet bedding around the self-feeders, automatic water valves, and the floor along
the front side of at least 8 enclosures in the guinea pig building. Inadequate cleaning and sanitation can expose the
guinea pigs to potential disease hazards and increased ammonia odors. Primary enclosures must be cleaned often
enough to prevent accumulations of excreta, soiled bedding and debris. In addition, primary enclosures must be sanitized
at least every 2 weeks. Correct by ensuring that all primary enclosures are kept clean and sanitized often enough to
prevent accumulations of soiled and wet bedding. Correct by February 22, 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a family member.
